channel.title: Velvet Squid - Experts in web & mobile, brand identity, creative direction, and innovation.
channel.description: Velvet Squid is a Sydney based design studio focusing on creating pixel perfect digital media. If you are a small business owner with a killer idea, or an established brand looking for creative direction, we can help you bring your ideas to life in print, web, and digital media.

item.title: Casestudy - Designing a better small business website
item.description:
Casestudy - Designing a better small business website

This month our design team reviews and overhauls a highly reputable Sydney based dentist at http://www.dentistonpaxton.com.au

See more

Team review and scores.

First Impressions

The user experience was outdated, a little confusing, and didn't reflect the same quality of service as presented at the surgery.

  • Design

    Score26

    Typical Layout and Design

    The design is very typical of a dentist website. Standard menu items. Lack of clear call to actions. Lots of text and stock photos.

  • Branding

    Score23

    Safe and Suitable

    The logo design and general branding of the business is actually quite suitable. The logo can work at both small and large scale. The word "dentist" would benefit from standing out more from the curved shape to make it easier to read.

  • User Experience

    Score29

    Confusing and Cluttered

    Customers have a goal when they find a website. They want to find out key information, determine if the service can be trusted, learn about the people behing the business, and make contact quickly and easily. This website attempts these goals, but makes a number of basic mistakes that hinders this goal.

  • Technology

    Score28

    PHP

    The website is built on a PHP framework which is a good solution. However, it could benefit hugely from a Content Management System like Wordpress to really take thing to the next level. The server configurement and lack of a cloud-based server is a concern. The speed is also a major concern.

  • Social

    Score56

    Facebook

    The Facebook page is a good decision for this company, and it makes a great first impression. This is the most successful approach to contacting customers to offer deals and provide updates - excellent work.

Performance

Score 22/30

Optimising your website's performance is crucial to increasing traffic, improving conversion rates, generating more leads, and increasing revenue.

SEO

Score 25/30

Making sure your website is easy for users to discover — and easy for search bots to understand—with better page titles, headings, and meta descriptions.

Recommended Improvements

Web Development

Revamp website to improve first impressions. With so many similar websites there is nothing making this site stand above the rest.

Booking System

Upgrade contact form technology and use an integrated booking system to help convert customer leads.

Content

Add a simple blog to help improve SEO ranking and attract organic traffic. Use this to help show the staff are Key People of Influence.

Design Concept

The designs below show a concept design that we feel would dramatically improve the online sales lead generation of potential customers. The key features include obvious call-to-actions, an advanced booking system, featured services, customer testimonials, success stories, and a price list that get's straight to the point.

Client:Casestudy - Designing a better small business website

Date:30 May, 2016

Link:

Having recently looked for a dentist in Sydney, I jumped online like everyone does. After a while I discoverd Casestudy - Designing a better small business website via a simple Google search. My first impressions were pretty typical of other competitor websites that I found.

My goal for this challenge was to design a fresh and engaging website. More importantly I wanted to implement a booking system, powerful customer onboarding tools, and provide a clear marketing plan for the business to leverage off.

item.title: 2016 Web Design Trends you need to consider for your site
item.description:
Recently, we’ve seen a surge in popularity of responsive web design, as more and more sites join the drive to become ‘mobile ready’ which is now even more important in the wake of Google’s Mobile Friendly update.

Let’s examine some of the most popular for this and the coming year.

The hamburger menu

Love it or hate it, the hamburger menu is still going strong in 2016. It’s extremely recognisable and it’s clean. Users are more familiar with this little three lined icon and until a new solution gains momentum their will be hamburgers everywhere.

Long Scroll

Placing all your important elements above the fold is now a well-known myth. Furthermore, almost everyone is accustomed to long scrolls thanks to mobile devices. The technique works especially well for sites that want to lure users through storytelling, and you can still mimic a multi-page site by breaking the scroll into clear sections.

Card layouts

Those little rectangles full of inclusive images and text have been so successful in Web design that they’ve almost become a default option when it comes to balancing clear aesthetics with simple usability. But don’t mistake trendiness for usefulness – there’s a reason cards are so popular.

Hero Video Headers

Websites design is going to the movies. Higher speed Internet connections and better video plugin integration is making it easier for more websites to include an immersive movie-style experience. Video clips are growing from small snippets to almost full-length preview clips. The images are sharp, crisp and in high definition, creating a video experience online that is new to users, but familiar from other devices, such as televisions.

Illustration and Sketches

Illustrations and sketches bring a fun element of whimsy to a site design. They can work for sites of all types and aren’t just for children anymore. The illustration style has also started to grow in popularity when it comes to some of the smaller pieces of website design as well, such as icons and other user interface elements. What’s nice about this trend is that illustrations make a site feel a little more personal. Because an illustration or sketch style icon appears to be hand-drawn, it looks and feels personal for users. That can go a long way into creating a connection with them.

Conclusion

Looking through the examples above it’s easy to see that there’s not just one web design trend that designers will focus on in the coming year. It’s a combination of multiple trends from the past few years.

What trends are you most excited about in 2016? Are there any we missed on this list? Join the conversation in the comments below.

item.title: Stop boring people to death with your slide presenatations
item.description:
You are using too much text

Presentations often involve a lot of content. Your message might be extremely complex and in depth. However, this doesn’t mean you should write it all down on the slide. The audience doesn’t want to read, they want to be entertained. They want to hear what you have to say. So please so displaying slides with hundreds of words. It’s a sure fire way to annoy your audience, plus it encourages you to read the content which shows you have not prepared yourself enough to use cliff-notes.

Accoring to a recent survey, one of the top frustrations people have with presentations is that there’s ‘too much text,’ yet a lot of slide presentations we see still look like larger-than-life index cards.

Tell a story instead of regurgitating information

Reading notes from your slides is something to be careful of doing too much. The audience can do this themselves. Better yet, tell your audience a story. Take them on a journey with your content rather than reading your notes. Be passionate, engaging, and explain why you are here to help them and use personal experience to help resonnate with everyone.

Arial is not the only font

PowerPoint default fonts like Tahoma and Arial are like primary colors. We’ve been using these standard typefaces in our slides for years; they aren’t just familiar, they’re antiquated.

Spice up your slides by adding premium fonts to your palette. There are tons of websites you can visit to download custom fonts for free, like:

  • Font Squirrel
  • Google Fonts

Use stock photos that don’t suck

We all recognise these images. We’ve seen them time and time again. They are cheesy, fake, and overly staged. Is this how you want people to think of your presentation. Didn’t think so! You need images that make us look like the savvy, cutting-edge businees people that you are.

Now, I know finding gorgeous images has never been easy. Subscription sites like ShutterStock and iStock don’t always agree with our budgets and reading the usage rights on free photos can be a headache. But, there are a few beautiful, high-quality photos websites out there worth visiting:

  • Unsplash

  • Picjumbo

  • Gratisography

  • Picography

  • Death to the Stock Photo

Bullet points trigger daydreaming

As soon as bullet points flash on the screen, the audience starts daydreaming or playing Angry Birds on their phone. We think bulleting our content will make it easier for people to absorb, when in reality, it makes it harder for them to stay awake. The solution to the ‘too much text’ problem isn’t condensing every paragraph into bullet points – it’s embracing visual elements.

Bullet points can be a great way to outline your presentation, but when actually presenting, make sure they’re gone from your deck. Remember, no one’s going to say, “I wish that presentation had more bullet points.”

Ditch the default template

No matter how good your presentation is, no matter how engaging you are at talking to the audience. If you decide to use a default PowerPoint template or Keynote template you need to stop. Put simply, they look terrible. There is so much potential to create amazing slides with these tools. The tools are so intuative and simple that web designers actually use them to show website animations these days.

We know that not everyone is a designer, but this is where Velvet Squid can help. We have a few guru presentation designers in our team and they are truly “slide ninjas”. Below

It’s time to call in the experts

Why not contact us at Velvet Squid and we can convert an existing slide deck or help you with your next project. You will be amazed at the difference it can make.

item.title: St Ives Dental Group
item.description:
St Ives Dental Group

This month the creative team has selected a dental website from St Ives.

See more

Team review and scores.

First Impressions

The user experience was very outdated, too simplistic, and performed very poorly with Google pange ranking. It's clear the site could have a much higher customer acquisition rate and benefit from some more recent advances in web design and development.

  • Design

    Score15

    Typical Layout and Design

    The design is very typical of an old dentist website. Standard menu items. Basic formatting. Lack of call to actions. Cluttered and often confusing layout.

  • Branding

    Score12

    Stock Standard Logo

    The logo design and general branding of the business is actually very basic and the design doesn't scale well or provide a strong recognisable silhouette.

  • User Experience

    Score18

    Confusing and Cluttered

    Customers have a goal when they find a website. They want to find out key information, determine if the service can be trusted, learn about the people behing the business, and make contact quickly and easily. This website attempts these goals, but makes a number of basic mistakes that hinders this goal.

  • Technology

    Score28

    Adobe Dreamweaver

    The website runs on JQuery and HTML which is a basic solution. The site was built using Dreamweaver which is isn't available anymore, and for good reason. There are much more powerful and simpler platforms to work with today.

  • Social

    Score

    Non Existent

    There is absolutely no social media precense at all. A Facebook page would be a good decision for this company, and it would grow their user base. This is also the most successful approach to contacting customers to offer deals and provide updates - excellent work.

Performance

Score 22/30

Optimising your website's performance is crucial to increasing traffic, improving conversion rates, generating more leads, and increasing revenue.

Mobile

Score 0/30

Traffic from mobile devices is growing fast. Optimize your website for mobile or you'll miss out on valuable traffic, leads, and revenue.

SEO

Score 15/30

Making sure your website is easy for users to discover — and easy for search bots to understand—with better page titles, headings, and meta descriptions.

Recommended Improvements

Mobile Opimisation

Websites that are not optimised for mobile devices are severly penalised by Google SEO ranking. This is a critical step for all businesses.

Booking System

Upgrade contact form technology and use an integrated booking system rather than a third party option.

Web Development

Revamp website to improve first impressions. The current site is doing a number of things correctly, but they just need a little advice.

Design Concept

The designs below show a concept design that we feel would dramatically improve online sales and lead generations of potential customers. The key features include obvious call-to-actions, an advanced booking system, highlighting featured services, adding customer testimonials and success stories, and including a price list that get's straight to the point.

Client:St Ives Dental Group

Date:30 May, 2016

Link:http://www.stivesdental.com.au/

Having recently looked for a dentist in St Ives, I jumped online like everyone does. After a while I discoverd St Ives Dental Group after a bit of a Google search. My first impressions were pretty typical of other competitor websites that I found.

My goal for this challenge was to design a fresh and engaging website. More importantly I wanted to implement a booking system, powerful customer onboarding tools, and provide a clear marketing plan for the business to leverage off.

item.title: Diamond Care Dental
item.description:
Diamond Care Dental

This month the creative team has selected a dental website from Sydney.

See more

Team review and scores.

First Impressions

The user experience was outdated, a little confusing, and didn't reflect the same quality of service as presented at the surgery.

  • Design

    Score42

    Typical Layout and Design

    The design is very typical of a dentist website. The colours were dark and hard to read. Adding a crisp and vibrant colour palette would help.

  • Branding

    Score54

    Safe and Suitable

    The logo design and general branding of the business is actually quite suitable. There is room for improvement, but there are bigger issues to focus on right.

  • User Experience

    Score38

    Confusing and Cluttered

    Customers have a goal when they find a website. They want to find out key information, determine if the service can be trusted, learn about the people behing the business, and make contact quickly and easily. This website attempts these goals, but makes a number of basic mistakes that hinders this goal.

  • Technology

    Score64

    Wordpress and Apache

    The website runs on Wordpress which is an excellent solution for this business. However, the server configurement and lack of a cloud-based server is a concern. The speed is also a major concern.

  • Social

    Score32

    Facebook only

    The Facebook page is a good decision for this company, however they are lacking a newsletter which is the most successful approach to contacting customers to offer deals and provide updates.

Performance

Score 9/30

Optimising your website's performance is crucial to increasing traffic, improving conversion rates, generating more leads, and increasing revenue.

SEO

Score 21/30

Making sure your website is easy for users to discover — and easy for search bots to understand—with better page titles, headings, and meta descriptions.

Recommended Improvements

Web Development

Revamp website to improve first impressions. Upgrade contact form technology. Use integrated booking system instead of Centaur Portal.

Marketing

Current paid advertising is actually doing more harm than good. Showcase more about the staff and build their reputations on the website.

Social

Use social media to showcase techniques and advanced technologies in the surgery. Show followers tips about hygiene, and provide discounts and advice.

Design Concept

The designs below show a concept design that we feel would dramatically improve the online sales lead generation of potential customers. The key features include obvious call-to-actions, an advanced booking system, featured services, customer testimonials, success stories, and a price list that get's straight to the point.

Client:Diamond Care Dental

Date:30 May, 2016

Link:diamondcaredental.com.au

Having recently looked for a dentist in Sydney, I jumped online like everyone does. After a while I discoverd Diamond Care Dental via a paid Google Advertisement. My first impressions were pretty typical of other competitor websites that I found.

My goal for this challenge was to design a fresh and engaging website. More importantly I wanted to implement a booking system, powerful customer onboarding tools, and provide a clear marketing plan for the business to leverage off.

item.title: 6 Reasons Your Website Needs to be Mobile Optimised
item.description:
1. Everyone is on mobile now.

1.2 billion people are accessing the web on mobile devices these days. An an incredible 80% of all internet users use a mobile device. So, in other words, it’s critical that your website is optimised for your potential visitors.

This trend in mobile use is snowballing too, so the sooner your get setup correctly for mobile users, the better your business will perform.

2. Over 50% of web traffic is now mobile.

You want to increase web traffic to your site right? Who doesn’t.

As of May 2014, mobile media consumption was 21% higher that that of desktop, accounting for 51% of all digital media consumption.

3. Responsive design is preferred for SEO.

In June 2012, at SMX Advanced, Google’s Pierre Farr went on the record to declare that Google prefers responsive web design over mobile templates. Having one single URL makes it easier for Google bot to crawl your site as well as reduces the chance of on-page SEO errors. For these reasons, responsive sites typically perform better and are easier to maintain than a separate, mobile-template site.

4. Mobile users behave a bit differently

Mobile users tend to consume a disproportionately high amount of visual media, with a major focus of image and videos.

Making sure you capture this audience requires an optimsed design to engage these users.

5. Mobile users buy more.

It’s a big call, but it’s completely true. Across devices, mobile users actually spend more than their desktop couterparts.

If you are attempting to sell something below $10, mobile users are your ideal audience.

6. Google rewards mobile responsiveness

For some time now, Google has rewarded sites that are mobile responsive.

With Google’s latest major algorithm update, the company enacted significant penalties for websites failing to meet its standards for mobile friendliness. While this change wasn’t quite the “mobile-geddon” SEO’s predicted, it did create some waves, with mobile friendly pages taking much less of a hit.

It’s time to get mobile

If your website is not optimised for mobile, you are being punished by Google, you are losing valuable customer leads, and you are harming your business potential.

The best part is, optimising your website for mobile is very simple and there are countless resources out there for you to implement. If you need a little help, make sure to contact our team.

item.title: Graphics
item.description:
Graphics

We do more than just create slick looking logos and letterheads, we help define your brand.

You only get one first impression

Make it count

Your business means everything to you, and you want to make a lasting and exacting impression, every time. Our design team are experts at creating everything from businees cards, stationary, print media, and presentations.

Lasting impressions.

Brand Identity

Our brand identity service empowers your company to present visuals that communicate your value proposition perfectly. We standardise a look and feel, then translate that across all points of exposure for your brand.

Small or large.

Flyers & Magazines

A professional flyer or magazine design is an inexpensive way to promote your business. Being a wonderful product, such flyers are considered to be an effective marketing tool for new business start-ups and established businesses.

Complete business kit.

Stationary

Quality stationery speaks a lot about the standards of your business. We don't just create artwork, we think about your brand identity and how to portray it in order to reap the maximum benefits from it.

Impress your live audience.

Presentations

Whether it’s pitching for new business, motivating your sales team or giving a keynote speech, we’ll ensure your presentation is influential, memorable and successful. Find out why our customers keep coming back each time.

What They Say

    Karen Gregory - LJ Hooker

item.title: Sydney Smiles Dental
item.description:
Sydney Smiles Dental

This month the creative team has selected a dental website from Chatswood.

See more

Team review and scores.

First Impressions

The user experience was very outdated, too simplistic, and performed very poorly with Google pange ranking. It's clear the site could have a much higher customer acquisition rate and benefit from some more recent advances in web design and development.

  • Design

    Score19

    Typical Layout and Design

    The design is very typical of an old dentist website. Standard menu items. Basic formatting. Lack of call to actions. Cluttered and often confusing layout.

  • Branding

    Score12

    Stock Logo

    The logo design and general branding of the business is actually very basic and the design doesn't scale well or provide a strong recognisable silhouette.

  • User Experience

    Score24

    Confusing and Cluttered

    Customers have a goal when they find a website. They want to find out key information, determine if the service can be trusted, learn about the people behing the business, and make contact quickly and easily. This website attempts these goals, but makes a number of basic mistakes that hinders this goal.

  • Technology

    Score36

    Wordpress, but setup incorrectly

    The website runs on Wordpress which is an excellent solution for this business. However, the server configurement and incorrectly setup cloud-based server puts this at one of the slowest sites we have come across.

  • Social

    Score32

    Small traction

    The Facebook page is a good decision for this company, however they are lacking traction which is quite easy to obtain once you know the right techniques.

Performance

Score 7/30

Optimising your website's performance is crucial to increasing traffic, improving conversion rates, generating more leads, and increasing revenue.

SEO

Score 20/30

Making sure your website is easy for users to discover — and easy for search bots to understand—with better page titles, headings, and meta descriptions.

Recommended Improvements

Web Development

Revamp website to improve first impressions. Upgrade contact form technology. Use integrated booking system to help convert more visitors.

Booking System

Upgrade contact form technology and use an integrated booking system rather than a third party option.

New Content

Updating the blog more frequently will help to improve SEO ranking and attract organic traffic. Use this to help show the staff are Key People of Influence.

Design Concept

The designs below show a concept design that we feel would dramatically improve online sales and lead generations of potential customers. The key features include obvious call-to-actions, an advanced booking system, highlighting featured services, adding customer testimonials and success stories, and including a price list that get's straight to the point.

Client:Sydney Smiles Dental

Date:30 May, 2016

Link:http://sydneysmilesdental.com.au/

Having recently looked for a dentist in Chatswood, I jumped online like everyone does. After a while I discoverd Sydney Smiles Dental after a bit of a Google search. My first impressions were pretty typical of other competitor websites that I found.

My goal for this challenge was to design a fresh and engaging website. More importantly I wanted to implement a booking system, powerful customer onboarding tools, and provide a clear marketing plan for the business to leverage off.

item.title: Wordpress Care
item.description:
Wordpress Care

Whether it's updates, security, performance problems, theme & plugin issues, we're here to help.

Start growing your business

A team you can trust

Stop worrying about your Wordpress site. You need to focus on your business instead of worrying about Wordpress updates, security, performance issues, and theme & plugin bugs.

Over the years our team have developed a range of in-house to make sure our client websites are safe, secure, optimised, and backed up perfectly.

If you want peace of mind, then simply select one of our Wordpress Care packages and stop adding to your workload and daily stress.

The Ultimate Wordpress Care Package.

Stress Free

Automatic Backups

Backups are the backbone of a successful Wordpress website. Automatic backups are just the next best thing.

24/7 Monitoring

Anything can happen online. This is why your website is monitored for any abnormal behaviour and downtime.

Optimisation

People want content quickly. A slow site can ruin your business. Let us give your site the boost it needs.

Security

We give you to power to revert your website to any date that it's been live. Now that is impressive power.

It's a sickening feeling, but it happens.

Restore Site

We backup you site locally, remotely, and on the cloud. We can restore versions from all locations.

Wordpress Support

Software Updates
